question: Q1. When you create a new, blank presentation, you begin with one blank slide. What is the layout name of this slide?
Q2. What do you use to align objects on a slide to one another?
Q3. Which option must be enabled if you want to manipulate the playback of a video file during a presentation?
Q4. Which feature analyzes the content of your slides and offers suggested options?
Q5. Where can you configure advanced PDF options?
Q6. Which tab is best for adding various types of objects to slides?
Q7. Which SmartArt category can you use to make informational graphics out of bullet points?
Q8. What is NOT checked when you run the Accessibility Checker?
Q9. How can you change the appearance of a table in one click?
options: Right-click a table and choose a new style.

question: Q10. Which option changes a text box so that it automatically changes shape to fit longer text?
Q11. Which three shadow properties can be adjusted in PowerPoint?
Q12. You want your presentation to play continuously on screen, What option must you set?
Q13. Which statement about the Compress Pictures command is true?
options: You can compress all images at the same time.
There are no options for print output.
You can compress only one image at a time.

question: Q14. You have a Word document you would like to import as an outline into a PowerPoint presentation. How should you format the text in your Word document that you want to be the slide content?
Q15. In what manner can you filter comments?
Q16. Which Arrow Options choice will hide the mouse cursor when presenting, except when the cursor is moved?
Q17. Which chart type is best suited for displaying annual financial data for a 10-year period?
Q18. If you want to create an organizational chart, which SmartArt category works best?
Q19. When printing multiple handouts, which option will group multipage documents together and make them easier to distribute?
Q20. How can you adjust which data in a table is used when working on a chart?
Q21. Which view lets you see additional information on a second monitor when delivering a presentation?
Q22. A picture looks good in your slide show but pixelated when you print it. How can you fix this?
options: Compress the picture and use the Print (220 ppi) resolution setting.
Select Best scale for slide show, increase the picture resolution and resize the picture to the original size
Change the printer property settings to print in a higher resolution.

question: Q23. You have inserted a video on a slide and want the video to automatically start 2 seconds after the associated slide appears. How can you accomplish this?
Q24. When inserting pictures, how can you avoid distorting the pictureif it is resized later?
options: Use best scale for slide show.
Set the picture to be relative to the orignal picture size.

question: Q25. Which Protect Presentation option protects a presentation from accidental changes?
Q26. How can you change colors in your presentation all at once without changing the design?
Q27. What function allows you to borrow slides from a presentation fro an other presentation?
options: There is no special fuction. You must use Copy and Pase

question: Q28. What is the term used for the arrangement of elements on a slide, such as Title and Content?
Q29. How would you change a list of text to a visual diagram on a slide?
Q30. You need to reorder the levels of shapes on a SmartArt diagram. How can this be done
options: Change the shapes from rifht to left.
Move the shapes up and down.

question: Q31. Why would you trim a video?
options: To remove background noise in the video.
To remove some of the beginning and/or end of the video.

question: Q32. How would you save your layouts, colors, fonts, effects, background styles and content for others to use with their presentations?
options: Export the file as a template.
Save the file as a PDF.
Save the file as a POTX.
Save the file as a PPTX.

question: Q33. You are creating an industrial presentation of a new software program and would like to include an image of your program. How can you use PowerPoint to do this?
Q34. How can you add more layouts to the Layout Gallery?
options: Add Slide Layouts to the Slide Master.

question: Q35. Why would you use the Outline view?
options: To see only the text in placeholders.
To present the slides at a high level.
To add text from a Word document.

question: Q36. The text on the left and right of the slide are cut off in print preview. How can you fix this in the printer settings?
Q37. In addition to organizing your slides, how else can sections increase your productivity?
options: In addition to organizing your slides, how else can sections increase your productivity?.
All the slides in a section can be selected at once to apply changes such as transitions, layouts or hiding slides.
Sections can be exported as a separate presentation.
You can resize all the slides in a section at once.

question: Q38. You have many slides that you need to reorder. How would you accomplish this?
options: Move the slides in Slide Show view.
Renumber the slides in Outline view.
Move the slides in the Slide Sorter view.

question: Q39. What can be seen in Presenter view?
Q40. How can you format the entire contents of a text box?
options: Click the dashed/dotted border of the text box.
Right-click the text box and select Select All.
Click the Fond button on the Home tab.
Double-click any word in the text box.

question: Q41. You have a large number of objects on your slide. How can you use the selection pane to help you identify the objects quickly?
options: Select the show/hide icons next to the objects.
Rename the objects with meaningful names.
Tab through the objects and note each object as it's highlighted.

question: Q42. How would you ensure a consistent appearance and placement across your slides even though the content might be different?
Q43. How can you add icons to SmartArt?
options: Select the picture icon in a SmartArt Picture Diagram.
Select the icon in a SmartArt Icon Diagram.
Select Insert Icon and place it on top of the SmartArt Diagram.
Select a SmartArt shape and select Insert Icon.

question: Q44. You are having trouble playing back a presentation smoothly. What should you do?
options: Copy the presentation to your internal hard drive.
Clear the **Disable hardware graphics acceleration** option.

question: Q45. Which feature lets you configure multiple combinations of specific slides for playback from a larger slideshow?
Q46. When working with a mapchart, which options can be drawn?
Q47. You receive feedback from two clients on your presentation. Each person sent you an edited file. What's the best way to review their changes?
Q48. How do you promote subbullets to top-level bullets?
options: Right-click the bulleted text and select Promote.

question: Q49. What is the term used for the arrangement of elements on a slide, such as Title and Content?
Q50. After you select the chart icon in a placeholder, what is the next step to create a chart?
options: Select the chart data in Excel.

question: Q51. How would you show a correlation between the amount of chocolate a city consumes and the number of crimes committed?
Q52. You want to use a morph transition between two slides. How do you set up the slides?
options: The two slides must have multiple objects in common with different names in the Selection pane
The two slides must have at least one obiect in common that is in a different position on the second slide
The second slide must have different objects that are in the same position as the objects on the first slide
The two slides must have at least one obiect in common that is in the same position on the second slide

question: Q53. Why would you use the Rehearse Timings command?
options: to determine how long it takes to present your slide show

question: Q54. How can you make an inserted picture look like it has been sketched or painted?
Q55. How can you modify your presentations entire set of colors with a single change?
Q56. You want to print full-page slides to fill 8. 5-by-11-inch paper, but they appear too small in the preview. What is the best way to rectify this?
options: Change the slide size to standard
Repeatedly bump up the scale setting print option until it fills the page in the preview
Change the scale setting print option to 100%
Select the **Scale to Fit Paper** print option

question: Q57. You want to import a Word document as an outline into a Powerpoint presentation. How should you format the Word documents text that you want to be the slide content?

options: Right-click a table and select a new style

question: Q60. Why would you use Outline view?
options: to quickly edit titles or bulleted text in the Slide pane
to view the comments on all slides
to add notes in the Slide pane
to change the font on all slides

question: Q61. Before publishing a presentation, which option should you use to scan a presentation and look for issues that may make it difficult for someone with a visual impairment to read?
Q62. How can you filter the series and/or categories in a chart?
options: Edit the data to remove the data for the series or category.
Use a filter so the data series or category does not display.

question: Q63. You have an object that needs to follow a specific motion path - including curves, straight lines, and loops - on the slide. Which animation gives the capability to draw this?
Q64. When you add encryption to a PowerPoint presentation, what does it do?
options: scrambles the text so it is unreadable when opened.
shares the file in cloud-based platform.
protects the file with a password.
requires the user to log in to their Office 365 account.

question: Q65. Which type of shape allows you to add text that can be moved around, formatted with styles and effects, or grouped with other objects?
Q66. You need to apply a special effect that will display as the presentation moves from one slide to the next slide. Which should you apply?
Q67. Which option can be used to import selected slides from a previously created presentation into a new presention without manually copying and pasting them?

Q68. The picture on the left is the original image. The image on the right is smaller, but the flowers are the same size and part of the picture has been removed. What method was used to format this picture?
options: changing the width and height with aspect ration locked

question: Q69. Which view allows you to see additional information on a second monitor when delivering a presentation?
Q70. You are copying and pasting slides from another presentation into your presentation. How will you ensure the new slides are consistent in appearance with your existing slides?
options: Select **Keep Source Formatting** when pasting the slides.
Select **Use Destination Theme** when pasting the slides.
Change both presentations to the same theme before copying and pasting.

question: Q71. What happens when you press the Esc key while playing a **From Current Slide** or **From Beginning** slide show?
options: The current slide is temporary hidden.
The slide show ends and you return to your previous view.

question: Q72. When you save a presentation with a `.potx` file extension, which type of Powerpoint file is created?
Q73. You are presenting with two monitors. Which view displays a preview of next slide and speaker notes on the second monitor?
Q74. Which effect can a presenter use to add motion to an object on a slide?
Q75. When you copy data from an Excel worksheet into a slide to create a table, which Paste option will allow you to edit the table data in Excel?
Q76. You created a photo album with transitions and want to send it to friends, but the file size is too large for email. How can you use one command to fix this?
options: Click **Export** in Backstage view and embed the presentation in an email.
Compress all the pictures to the **Email (96 ppi) resolution**.
Use the Share feature in Backstage view and petty email to automatically compress the pictures.
Use the Share feature in Backstage view to create a pdf to send as an attachment.

question: Q77. In a presentation about voter turnout, you are illustrating various data with charts. Which type of information would you present in a pie chart?
options: the decline of voter turnout by county
trends in voter turnout over the part 10 years
what percentage of the whole population voted
how many people voted in various geographic regions on a map

question: Q78. A few lines of text are overflowing the placeholder on your slide. How can you fix it on your slide?
options: Select **Stop Fitting Text to This Placeholder**.

question: Q79. If you want to create an organizational chart that illustrates the reporting relationships within the organization, which SmartArt category would you use?
Q80. What do the labels Introduction and ProjectsByMonth indicate?
Q81. There are objects and text hidden behind an image on your slide. With the image selected, what could you adjust to make the objects and text appear "through" the image?
